alert.note: Alert for Matagorda; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 01 at 7:15PM CST until February 02 at 11:35AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Tres Palacios River near Midfield affecting Wharton and Matagorda Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Tres Palacios River near Midfield. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins with water well into the flood plain on the right upstream bank and within inches of spilling over the east approach to the bridge at FM 456. The river will be almost one quarter mile wide in the vicinity of the gage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 25.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 PM CST Tuesday was 25.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight or tomorrow morning and continue falling to 4.0 feet Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.2 feet on 06/23/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Tres Palacios River Midfield 24.0 25.2 Tue 6 pm CST 13.9 7.1 5.1 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 715 AM CST.
